bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Chemical Health and Safety (CHAS) is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. The division has over 1500 members, including chemists, health and safety professionals and other scientists working to promote the responsible use of hazardous chemicals. The division's main interest is in "technical research about the hazards and management of these chemicals as they are used in the laboratory, the general workplace and the economy as a whole."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the ACS Division of Chemical Health and Safety. Records include: financial records (1984-1994); programs from national meetings (1978-1992); loose copies and a bound volume of the CHAS Notes newsletter (1982-1999); copies of the Chemical Health and Safety journal (1994-1999); membership and committee lists; bound "Extended Abstracts" from papers given at national meetings (1992-1994); guidelines for public policy statements and communications; and miscellaneous correspondence. The collection also includes a set of commemorative CHAS wine glasses.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
